title: Story
description: Stories represent the events' story arc. Stories might represent complete story arcs consisting of sub-stories or simple encounters

id.description: The unique identifier of a story

setting.description: The setting that this story belongs to

name.description: The unique name of this story

description.description: A description short description for game masters and extra's about the story

plot.description: The actual content of the story

type.description: The type of experience that this story offers.

gameMasters.description: The game masters responsible for this story

audience.description: The characters this story tries to cater to

dependsOn.description: Any other story that should have been completed in order to run this story. Normally used to link encounters into a logic chain to make sure that all information reaches the character

participatingCharacters.description: The characters participating in this story. e.g. when along on the encounter.

items.description: Items that characters might earn during this story

conditions.description: Conditions that characters during this story might obtain

startDate.description: The moment that this story should start

endData.description: The moment that this story should end

location.description: The place within the location that is used for the story

extras.description: The extra's that are assigned to this story

minimumExtras.description: the amount of extras that are required at minimum to run this story

optimalExtras.description: The amount of extra's that the game master would like to have for this story

critical.description: Whether or not this story is critical to the even propagation. In other words, if it can be canceled or shuffled around
